item.title: Actionhandler teleports re-done
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

I’d actually rather use an array.

public int[][] locations = { { 2261, 3040, 4843, 0 } };
for (int i = 0; i < locations.length; i++) {
	if (actionButton == locations[i][0])
		c.getPA().startTeleport(locations[i][1], locations[i][2], locations[i][3], "modern");
}

Even thought it may look messy to you.

But still, enums vs. arrays topic not needed. It’s personal preference.

Read full topic

item.title: Actionhandler teleports re-done
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

fed up of seeing this shit in ActionHandler.java:

case 2261: c.getPA().startTeleport(3040, 4843, 0, "modern"); break; case 2231: c.getPA().startTeleport(3040, 4843, 0, "modern"); break; case 22361: c.getPA().startTeleport(3040, 4843, 0, "modern"); break; case 2361: c.getPA().startTeleport(3040, 4843, 0, "modern"); break; case 2511: c.getPA().startTeleport(3040, 4843, 0, "modern"); break; case 2531: c.getPA().startTeleport(3040, 4843, 0, "modern"); break;

so delete all the startTeleport methods and add this underneath firstClickObject:

GlobalObject.java:

[code]package server.world;

import server.model.players.Client;

/**
*

  • @author Rhubarb/Int Bauk

*/
public class GlobalObject {

public enum ObjectType {
	VARROCK_PORTAL(2465, 2911, 4832, 0, "modern"),
	ESSENCE_PORTAL(2492, 3253, 3402, 0, "modern"),
	WILDERNESS_LADDER(1766, 3016, 3849, 0, "modern"),
	LEAVER_KBD(1816, 2271, 4680, 0, "modern");
	
	int objectId; int absX, absY, height; String bookType;
	
	/**
	 * Our constructor for the enum ObjectType.
	 * @param objectId
	 * @param absX
	 * @param absY
	 * @param height
	 * @param bookType
	 */
	ObjectType(int objectId, int absX, int absY, int height, String bookType) {
		this.objectId = objectId;
		this.absX = absX;
		this.absY = absY;
		this.height = height;
		this.bookType = bookType;
		
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets the objectId
	 * @return objectId
	 */
	public int getObjectId() {
		return objectId;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets x axes.
	 * @return absX
	 */
	public int getAbsX() {
		return absX;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets y axes.
	 * @return absY
	 */
	public int getAbsY() {
		return absY;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets height.
	 * @return height
	 */
	public int getHeight() {
		return height;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Gets book.
	 * @return bookType
	 */
	public String getBookType() {
		return bookType;
	}

}

/**
 * Handles the teleport.
 * @param c
 * @param objectType
 */
public static void handleTeleportation(Client c, int objectType) {
	for (final ObjectType object : ObjectType.values()) {
		if(objectType == object.getObjectId()) {
			c.getPA().startTeleport(object.getAbsX(),object.getAbsY(), object.getHeight(), object.getBookType());
			}
		}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
